, showing growth. EUS / FNA may be performed or imaging follow-up with contrast-enhanced MRI or pancreas-protocol CT in 1 year. EUS / FNA merits stronger consideration for larger or faster-growing cysts relative to smaller or slower-growing cysts. If growth is >2 mm/year, the cyst is more likely to be aggressive.
, showing growth.

. Recommend imaging follow-up with contrast-enhanced MRI or pancreas-protocol CT every 2 years for 10 years. Consider stopping follow-up at age 80, depending on co-morbidities and patient preferences.

, showing growth. For an incidental pancreatic cyst, measuring 2.5 cm or less in individuals with 80 years or more at presentation, recommend imaging follow-up with contrast-enhanced MRI or pancreas protocol CT in 1 year. Imaging follow-up can be discontinnued if stable or if no longer surgical candidate.
, showing growth. For an incidental pancreatic cyst, measuring 2.5 cm or less in individuals with 80 years or more at presentation.

Pancreatic serous cystadenomas <4 cm are likely benign and no follow-up is recommended.

, showing growth. Recommend imaging follow-up with contrast-enhanced MRI or pancreas-protocol CT every 6 months for up to 1 year vs. immediate EUS / FNA. If growth is >2 mm/year, the cyst is more likely to be aggressive. EUS / FNA merits stronger consideration for larger or faster-growing cysts.
